name: help
description: Shows the help page, listing all available admin commands. If followed with an admin command it shows info on that command
short_description: Shows help page for admins
further_details: If you meant to see help on normal commands, use `[prefix]help`

name: overview
description: Shows an overview of all current settings/preferences for this bot in your server
short_description: Shows an overview of the bot settings for this server
further_details: These settings/preferences can be changed using admin commands. See `[admin_prefix]help`

name: prefix
description: Allows to set a custom prefix for user commands. Use `set` followed by a prefix to set it, `show` to show current prefix, or `reset` to reset the prefix to `.`
short_description: Allows to set a custom prefix for user commands
further_details: Must be a single non-alphabetic character. Cannot be the same as other prefixes. For other prefixes see `[admin_prefix]ap` and `[admin_prefix]mp`

name: adminPrefix
description: Allows to set a custom prefix for admin commands. Use `set` followed by a prefix to set it, `show` to show current prefix, or `reset` to reset the prefix to `=`
short_description: Sets the prefix for admin commands
further_details: Must be a single non-alphabetic character. Cannot be the same as other prefixes. For other prefixes see `[admin_prefix]p` and `[admin_prefix]mp`

name: musicPrefix
description: Allows to set a custom prefix for music commands. Use `set` followed by a prefix to set it, `show` to show current prefix, or `reset` to reset the prefix to `=`
short_description: Sets the prefix for music commands
further_details: Must be a single non-alphabetic character. Cannot be the same as other prefixes. For other prefixes see `[admin_prefix]p` and `[admin_prefix]ap`

name: logsChannel
description: Allows to set the channel on which bot related logs will be sent. I must have **Embed Links** permission in that channel. Use `set` followed by a channel ID/mention to set it, `show` to show current logs channel, or `unset` to stop logging to the currently set channel
short_description: Set channel for logs related to this bot
further_details: Preferably a private channel only for mods. This channel will likely be busy so make sure it is muted. Can be a log channel used by another bot

name: spamChannel
description: Allows to set the channel that will be an exception from commands restrictions, if needed. Use `set` followed by a channel ID/mention to set it, `show` to show current spam channel, or `unset` to unset the currently set channel as spam
short_description: Allows to set spam channel as an exception for disabled commands
further_details: In case of disabling any sort of commands (f.e. Anime and Manga), you can set a channel here that will override and allow all commands. Two exceptions are fun and moderation commands which cannot be used anywhere until re-enabled

name: animeChannels
description: Allows channels specified to override the Anime and Manga commands being disabled. Use `add` or `remove` to use that action on the provided channel ID, and  `show` or `clear` to show currently added channels or to clear them
short_description: Allows Anime and Manga commands in specific channels
further_details: These commands are usually lengthy and can cause spam, therefore it is best to disable them and add specific channels here to make them usable there only. See `[admin_prefix]disablesection`

name: enableSection
description: Enables a section/module of commands if disabled before. Takes section name
short_description: Enables a commands section
further_details: Check `[prefix]help` to see all sections. Related commands: `[admin_prefix]disable` to disable a section. `[admin_prefix]setspamchannel` to set a channel to override any disable done on sections/categories

name: disableSection
description: Disables a section/module of commands to make them unusable on this server (except for the spam channel if set (see `[admin_prefix]setspamchannel`)). Takes section name
short_description: Disables a commands section/module
further_details: Check `[prefix]help` to see all sections. Related commands: `[admin_prefix]enable` to re-enable a section. `[admin_prefix]setspamchannel` to set a channel to override any disable done on sections/categories

name: rolePersistence
description:
Enable/disable restoring roles for members who leave and rejoin. If enabled, the bot will store what roles the member had before leaving, and will reinstate them upon member rejoining.
Use `enable` or `disable` to enable/disable this feature
short_description: Enable/disable restoring roles for members who leave and rejoin
further_details: This overrides autoroles if the member left after this setting was enabled (had at least one role before leaving) and rejoined. These roles are added 3 seconds after the member joins

name: autoroles
description: Allows to assign new members specific roles upon their arrival. Use `add` or `remove` to use that action on the provided role ID, and  `show` or `clear` to show currently added roles or to clear them
short_description: Assign roles to new members upon joining the server
further_details: Besides the necessary 'Manage Roles' permission needed for the bot, added roles also need to be lower than the highest role for this bot

name: autoResponses
description:
Allows for this bot to respond to certain words or phrases (case insensitive).
Use `add` or `remove` to use that action on the provided trigger word/phrase, and  `show` or `clear` to show currently added responses or to clear them.
Provide with option `-delete`/`-d` to delete the sender's message.
Provide with `-full`/`-f` (entire message is the word/phrase), `-partial`/`-p` (only part of the message is the word/phrase) or `-startswith`/`-s` (the message starts with the word/phrase) to specify word/phrase match type, defaults to `full`
short_description: Auto-respond to words/phrases
further_details: Use {member_mention} in the response to mention the sender. Needs the 'Manage Messages' permission when using `-delete` option. No need to worry about the letters case, since everything is processed as lowercase

name: bannedWords
description:
Automatic deletion of messages that contain any words that were added as banned/blacklisted (case insensitive).
Use `add` or `remove` to use that action on the provided word, and  `show` or `clear` to show currently added words or to clear them.
Provide with option `-warn`/`-w` to warn the user.
Provide with `-full`/`-f` for a full word match or `-partial`/`-p` for a partial word match. **Advanced:** Provide with `-regex`/`-r` instead of match type to ban words/phrases using regular expression
short_description: Auto-delete banned words
further_details:
See `[admin_prefix]whitelistedrole` to whitelist a role from being triggering automod's banned words. See [prefix]help warn to get familiar with what warnings do. Please note that normal commands names and their aliases will be overlooked. 
**Advanced:** For `-regex` option, use regexr.com to validate your expression (mind that regex in here is case insensitive, unlike regexr.com)

name: singleMessage
description:
Allows users to only send one message in the specified channel. Provide a channel ID or mention followed by a role name that should be **created**.
Use `add` or `remove` to use that action on the channel and role, `show` or `clear` to show current single-message channels or to clear them.
Provide `add` with option `-s`/`-scan` to scan previous messages in the channel and give members the role.
Provide `add` with option `-d`/`-delete` to delete messages by members who already sent a message, or with option `-p`/`-permission` to prevent members who sent a message from sending another message at all
short_description: Enable single-message-per-member mode on a channel
further_details:
**Ignores members with administrator permission.** Defaults to `-delete` mode if not specified otherwise. Members will receive the role 5 seconds after their **first** message. For the `-permission` mode, the role given has its 'Send Messages' channel permission disabled. However, for `-delete` mode, any **new** messages sent by members with the given role will be deleted immediately.
**Important note:** I will create the role at the bottom of the hierarchy, so make sure to move it as necessary in accordance to other permissions.
Scan: `-scan` option will only read the latest 300 messages.
Mode: using `-permission` mode will also prevent members from editing previous messages, this is why it is highly recommended to go with `-delete` mode

name: galleryChannel
description:
Allows users to only send images on a channel, while text-only messages get deleted.
Use `add` or `remove` followed by a channel ID or mention to enable gallery mode on the channel or to disable it, `show` or `clear` to show current gallery channels or to clear them
short_description: Enable gallery mode (images only) on a channel
further_details: Ignores members with administrator permission

name: whitelistedRole
description: Set the role which will be whitelisted from triggering automod's banned words detection. Any role above this will be whitelisted as well. Use `set` followed by a role ID to set it, `show` to show currently set role, or `unset` to unset the currently set role
short_description: Set whitelisted role for automod's banned words detection
further_details: Related command: `[admin_prefix]bannedwords`

name: reactRole
description: React roles are roles that are given to the member when they react with an emoji to a message. Command must be used in the same channel as the message. By default this removes the role upon un-reacting
short_description: React roles for members
further_details:
Must provide a custom emoji for now, might add support for default emojis in the future. You can get an emoji's ID by sending it on discord with a backslash preceding it (\). I must be in the server the emoji is from.
There is no customization in any aspect for now

name: xpGain
description: Enabled by default. Members will gain XP on this bot while this is enabled and disabling it disables other XP features. This command also allows customization of XP gain (see notes and usage examples below)
short_description: Customize XP gain for members
further_details:
â€¢ Sub-command `timeframe` is followed by number of seconds during which members can only gain XP once no matter how many messages they send (this prevents spam-abuse of levelling).
â€¢ Sub-command `max` is the maximum amount of XP that can be given to members during each timeframe, while `min` is the minimum. `booster` is followed by a number which is the bonus percentage for boosting members.
â€¢ Default values are 60 seconds for timeframe, max of 40 XP, min of 20 XP, and 0% booster bonus. `reset` resets to these values

name: levelupMessage
description:
When enabled, sends level up messages. 
Sub-commands `enable` and `disable` control whether messages are sent or not. 
Sub-commands `set`, `show`, `reset` control the message itself. See notes below on how the message is set
short_description: Enable sending messages when members level up
further_details:
There is a default level up message. When setting the level up message you can use the following keywords which I will substitute on each level up message:
â€¢ `{member_mention}`: will be replaced with the levelling up member's mention.
â€¢ `{member_tag}`: will be replaced with the levelling up member's tag (e.g. Chazzy#0001).
â€¢ `{level}`: will be replaced with the level which the member just hit
usage_examples: [admin_prefix]levelupMessage set Well done {member_mention} on reaching level {level}!

name: levelupChannel
description: When set, I will send all level up messages to the desired channel, otherwise each level up message will be sent to the channel where the member was chatting
short_description: Send all level up messages to a particular channel
further_details: `set` is used to set the channel, `show` is used to show which channel is currently set, and `unset` unsets and the channel and makes level up messages be sent to the channel being chatted on

name: levelupRoles
description: I will give specified roles to members upon reaching the level each role is tied to. See examples below
short_description: Role rewards upon levelling up
further_details: Sub-commands `add`, `remove` do as implied, `show` lists all rewarded levels/roles and `clear` removes all. Sub-command `stack` enables/disables stacking level roles

name: xpDecay
description:
When enabled: after members go inactive for a certain number of days, I will start reducing their XP.
â€¢ `enable` and `disable` sub-commands do as implied.
â€¢ `percentage` sets the percentage which I will reduce from inactive members' XP everyday.
â€¢ `days` specifies how many days since the member's latest message need to pass before decaying starts applying to them
â€¢ `reset` resets to default values (see notes)
short_description: Decaying inactive members' XP and Levels
further_details: Default percentage is 1%. Default number of days til members are deemed inactive is 7. Using `reset` resets back to these values

name: xpIgnoredChannels
description: Channels added will be not gain members XP when they talk in it (for example: bot spam channels)
short_description: Channels to ignore for XP gain
further_details: Sub-commands `add`, `remove` do as implied, `show` lists all ignored channels and `clear` removes all

name: xpIgnoredRoles
description: Roles added will cause members who have any of them to not gain XP
short_description: Roles whose members will be ignored for XP gain
further_details: Sub-commands `add`, `remove` do as implied, `show` lists all ignored roles and `clear` removes all

name: xp
description: Allows you to give, take or reset XP to a member or to everyone
short_description: Give, take or reset XP for members
further_details: Use `all` after sub-command to apply to everyone in the server

name: xpOverview
description: Shows an overview of all XP settings. Since they are all over the place and a bit messy this should help
short_description: Overview for server's XP settings
